disease: Malignant melanoma of unspecified ear and external auricular canal

symptoms.name: Mass in the external auditory canal

physical_findings: 3x3cm spherical swelling in the right post auricular region
Swelling variable in consistency and very tender
Skin over swelling stretched, shiny, and smooth except for a small 0.5x0.5cm irregular ulcer with indurated margins in the inferior part of the swelling which was bleeding
Bluish-black mass arising in the EAC
Left sided parotid and preauricular lymph node swellings
risk_factors: Family history of melanoma (approximately 10% of patients)

imaging_findings.CT scan of the right temporal bone: Large ill-defined homogenous, moderately enhancing infiltrative soft tissue lesion occupying the entire EAC causing widening and erosion of anterior, posterior and inferior walls of the bony part of the EAC. Scutum, long process and the lenticular process of incus appeared irregular and eroded.
imaging_findings.Bone scan: Increased tracer concentration in the right temporal bone - possibility of a neoplastic lesion

required: Histopathological examination showing sheets and nests of atypical melanocytes with large pleomorphic nuclei with prominent nucleoli. Cytoplasm may or may not contain melanin pigment.
Immunohistochemistry positive for HMB45 and S100
supportive: Clinical presentation with ear pain, bleeding, postauricular swelling, and mass in the external auditory canal
Imaging findings consistent with malignant melanoma
